summary: This bill, S. 1000, proposes the establishment of an Ambassador-at-Large for Arctic Affairs within the Department of State. The Ambassador, appointed by the President with Senate consent, will represent the U.S. on Arctic matters, coordinate programs, and be responsible to the Secretary of State for foreign policy related to the Arctic. Duties include overseeing areas like national security, cooperation with Arctic countries, resource management, environmental protection, indigenous peoples, and scientific research. The bill defines the Arctic region and identifies Arctic countries.
